Comment: This is impeachable. He took an oath to defend the constitution and a person’s immigration status, legal or otherwise, does not matter. The 5th and 14th amendments of our constitution guarantees  all people within our borders due process. If a president publicly states they won't (or doesn’t know if they will) uphold the Constitution, it’s a violation of the Oath of Office, an impeachable offense. You may not like it, you may not agree with it, but that’s where we stand.

Comment: The oath of office for the President of the United States is: "I do solemnly swear (or affirm) that I will faithfully execute the Office of President of the United States, and will to the best of my ability, preserve, protect and defend the Constitution of the United States." This oath is specified in Article II, Section 1, Clause 8 of the U.S. Constitution.

Comment: It would be nice if it were that simple. But because they declared an emergency and then used the alien enemies act as cover, they can make the argument that they are operating within the law. However, the courts have recently clarified that position as not being valid, although that was done at a district level, so it now has to go through the appellate system. The bigger issue currently is that they have not obeyed the orders of the SCOTUS and lower level courts that have ordered them to facilitate the return of Garcia. President Trump even recently said he could have him returned but he won't - so this isn't a confusion over whether they can or cannot - they simply won't. That IMO warrants his removal.
